Course Description: Discrete Mathematics is the study of mathematical structures (objects) which are discrete, distinct in nature. This course provides the mathematical basis for the understanding of computers and modern computation. It is the backbone of computer science and has a lot of applications in cryptography and engineering.

Prerequisites.Mandatory: A good knowledge of elementary mathematics, esp. algebra, calculus and basic programming language.

Course Outcomes.CO1: Students are able to read, interpret and write some basic mathematical notations.
Course Outcomes.CO2: Students are able to recognize and to construct examples of mathematical objects introduced during the course such as the sets and functions.
Course Outcomes.CO3: Students are able to develop several matematical models.
Course Outcomes.CO4: Students are able to develop several matematical models.

Weekly Lecture Plan.Lecture Topic: Introduction to Logic, Predicates and Quantifiers
Rules of Inferences, Introduction to Proofs
Introduction to Turing Machines, Bog O Notation and Others
Chinese Remainder Theorem, Mathematical Induction, Sturctural Induction
Relations and their properties, Partial Orderings
Graphs and their various types, Shortest Path
Trees and Traversal, Minimum Spanning Trees
